messages.content: I missed the 10:30am standup because I was debugging. It's Wednesday afternoon which is my no-meeting focus time, so I can catch up now. What's the status of TF-247?
TF-247 (task sharing) is merged. The feature flag is active in staging. Also, Monday morning's sprint planning added two new tickets for the collaboration sprint you're working on.
Good. My working hours are 10am to 6pm PT so I've got a few hours left. Let's work on improving the task list query that David Liu flagged - it's slow when users have over 1000 tasks.
Looking at the query in task_repository.py. Found the issue - it's using SELECT * which pulls all columns including the large description field. Also missing an index on user_id.
I hate SELECT *. Never use that in database queries - always specify exactly the columns you need. Fix that and add the index. We need this fixed before TaskFlow AI's demo day.
Updated the query to select only needed columns. Created an Alembic migration to add the user_id index. Query time dropped from 2.3s to 180ms for a user with 1500 tasks.

Much better. TaskFlow AI's demo day for investors is on the 15th of next month so we need to make sure the app performs well. Also, our auth system is using a legacy JWT library that needs refactoring eventually.
Noted. I've added the auth refactoring to the tech debt backlog. For now, the JWT tokens still work with 15-minute expiry in the Authorization header as configured.
